question.title: JavaFX setting window Always on top with JNA lib, windows os

node.contents: I have to put my application transparent window over the top of every application//not just within application < Im aware that i can set modality on stage and put it on top bud thats not what i look for >// (same functionality as swing's setAlwaysOnTop(true)),bud since this is JavaFX application i dont have this option yet.So i decided to go native, i have JNA class

astNode.text: I have to put my application transparent window over the top of every application//not just within application < Im aware that i can set modality on stage and put it on top bud thats not what i look for >// (same functionality as swing's setAlwaysOnTop(true)),bud since this is JavaFX application i dont have this option yet.So i decided to go native, i have JNA class

elements.contents: public interface Kernel32 extends StdCallLibrary { public static class WinOnTop extends Structure { public HWND hWnd; public HWND hWndInsertAfter; public int X; public int Y; public int cx; public int cy; public int uFlags; @Override protected List getFieldOrder() { return Arrays.asList(new String[]{"hWnd", "hWndInsertAfter", "X", "Y", "cx", "cy", "uFlags"}); } } boolean SetWindowPos(HWND hWnd, HWND hWndInsertAfter, int X, int Y, int cx, int cy, int uFlags); }

units.rawText: public interface Kernel32 extends StdCallLibrary { public static class WinOnTop extends Structure { public HWND hWnd; public HWND hWndInsertAfter; public int X; public int Y; public int cx; public int cy; public int uFlags; @Override protected List getFieldOrder() { return Arrays.asList(new String[]{"hWnd", "hWndInsertAfter", "X", "Y", "cx", "cy", "uFlags"}); } } boolean SetWindowPos(HWND hWnd, HWND hWndInsertAfter, int X, int Y, int cx, int cy, int uFlags); }

node.contents: I don't see it, and its not listed in the feature changes. Maybe with the next one.

astNode.text: I don't see it, and its not listed in the feature changes. Maybe with the next one.

node.contents: @Stephen [stage.setAlwaysOnTop](http://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/javafx/api/javafx/stage/Stage.html#setAlwaysOnTop-boolean-) is in the current Java version (8u20), you don't need to wait for the next one.

astNode.text: @Stephen [stage.setAlwaysOnTop](http://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/javafx/api/javafx/stage/Stage.html#setAlwaysOnTop-boolean-) is in the current Java version (8u20), you don't need to wait for the next one.

node.contents: @Stephen Wille If you dont see it maybe your project still use 8 not 8u20, try to change version of JDK that your project uses.

astNode.text: @Stephen Wille If you dont see it maybe your project still use 8 not 8u20, try to change version of JDK that your project uses.

node.contents: Don't use JNA, use Java8u20 which has a JavaFX always on top feature.

astNode.text: Don't use JNA, use Java8u20 which has a JavaFX always on top feature.

node.contents: There is a nice blog post by Carl Dea on always on top.

astNode.text: There is a nice blog post by Carl Dea on always on top.
